title: ’Not enough words to describe pain’
text:
Lin family murders: Surviving relative Brenda tells how killings affected her life February 16, 2017 4:07pm Brenda Lin: “I will have to live with the aftermath of the crime for the rest of my life.” Share on Twitter 
BRENDA Lin has revealed the pain of losing her entire family – her father, mother, aunt and two little brothers and being sexually abused by Robert Xie, her killer uncle. 
Brenda Lin has told a court about how she went on a school trip to New Caledonia and while she was there her uncle – Robert Xie — bashed her family to death as they slept in their beds at their North Epping home in 2009. 
Ms Lin read a harrowing victim impact statement to the NSW Supreme Court last Friday but the details contained within it and her identity were suppressed until she gave her consent to Channel Seven’s Sunday Night program to be identified. Brenda Lin arrives at the Supreme Court for Robert Xie's sentencing this week. Picture: John Grainger   
Now that she has given her consent it can also be revealed that her killer uncle Robert Xie was partly motivated to wipe out her entire family so he could have unfettered sexual access to her. 
During the trial the court heard that Xie had touched Ms Lin sexually before the murders but that his advances grew more intense when she moved in with Xie and her aunt Kathy Lin after the murders. 
“I do not even know how to begin to express how the murder of my immediate family have impacted my life – there are not enough words to describe the pain and suffering caused me and those around me,” Ms Lin said last week. Brenda Lin endures the heartache of the funerals of her family members along with relatives in 2009. Picture: Getty Source: News Limited Robert Xie is taken to prison after being sentenced to five life sentences.   Grandmother Yang Fei Lin remembers her slain family. Picture: Jeremy Piper   
“It’s been 7.5 years since I lost my family – that is 7.5 years without a loving mother, seven half years without a loving father, 7.5 years without two exuberant brothers who were my best and closest friends and 7.5 years without an extremely kind aunt,” she said. 
In January, Xie was found guilty by majority verdict of murdering his brother-in-law Min “Norman” Lin, 45, Mr Lin’s wife Yun Li “Lily” Lin, 43, her sister Yun Bin “Irene” Yin, 39, and the Lins’ two young boys Henry, 12, and Terry, 9, as they slept in their beds. Brenda at 17, attempting to get on with her life as a high school student. Source: News Limited Brenda regrets not hugging her father before she left for the 2009 school trip. Picture: John Grainger   
During her sentencing remarks the Justice Elizabeth Fullerton described the murders as “a single episode of brutal and calculated murderous violence” and “a course of offending that can only be described as heinous in the extreme”. 
On Monday she sentenced the mass murderer to five life sentences for each of the five family members he killed. 
Xie has always maintained his innocence and his wife Kathy – whose family was murdered - continues to stand by him. Xie sentenced to life in jail for Lin murders 2:22 
Robert Xie has been sentenced to life in jail over the murder of five members of the Lin family. February 13th 2017 3 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/News/ 
Ms Lin also explained the devastating last moment she saw her father at the airport – a moment when she, as an awkward teenager, decided to not give him a hug goodbye. 
“To this day my biggest regret was not hugging him and telling him I loved him, to say thank you for being an amazingly loving and caring parent,” she said. 
“The pain of losing loved ones that never goes away and does not get any easier with time – as time goes on others may forget but I will have to live with the aftermath of the crime for the rest of my life.”
